text: Malouetia is a genus of plants in the family Apocynaceae, first described as a genus in 1844. It is native to Africa, South America, Central America, and the West Indies. ;Species ;formerly included * Malouetia asiatica Siebold & Zucc. = Trachelospermum asiaticum (Siebold & Zucc.) Nakai * Malouetia riparia (Kunth) A.DC. = Tabernaemontana grandiflora Jacq. * Malouetia tetrastachya (Kunth) Miers = Tabernaemontana siphilitica (L.f.) Leeuwenb. ==Uses== Malouetia tamaquarina is used as an additive to some versions of the hallucinogenic drink Ayahuasca. ==References== Category:Apocynaceae genera Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Malouetia
